result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Louis Canfield/ 608302-A was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert Louis Canfield/ 608302-A is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert Louis Canfield/ 608302-A was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Concurrent to Ozaukee County Case #13CF108.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: to Ozaukee County Case #13CF108

superMiscConds.notes: $250.00 restitution to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF60.
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF60.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Matthew L Hartung,  DF ATTY:  Lida Marie Bannink,  DF:  Robert Louis Canfield/ 608302-A appears from jail.  Atty Bannink states she has received the plea questionnaire from Defendant - with a plea to Count 1 and Count 2 dismissed with 2 years initial confinement and extended supervision to be concurrent to 13CF108. State requests costs only,  $250.00 restitution and waive DNA surcharge.  Court questions Defendant and finds he freely,  voluntarily and knowningly waives his rights. Defendant enters a Guilty plea to Count 1. Court finds a factual basis and accepts Defendant's plea to Count 1 and finds him Guilty. On motion of the State Count 2 is dismissed. Defendant apologizes and makes a statement. Court orders:

Total Sentence is 7 years
-2 Years Initial Confinement and 5 Extended Supervision concurrent to Ozaukee County Case 13CF108
-Court costs of $268.00 
-Restitution in the amount of $250.00
-Defendant has 20 days from today to file a notice of appeal.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
